classdef.name: DocumentMode
classdef.shortdesc: The document's color mode.

property.name: GRAYSCALE
property.shortdesc: Grayscale.

property.name: RGB
property.shortdesc: RGB.

property.name: CMYK
property.shortdesc: CMYK.

property.name: LAB
property.shortdesc: Lab.

property.name: BITMAP
property.shortdesc: Bitmap, which uses one of two color values (black or white) to represent the pixels in an image.

property.name: INDEXEDCOLOR
property.shortdesc: Indexed color, in which the number of colors in the image is at most 256, the standard number of colors supported by the GIF and PNG-8 formats and many multimedia applications.

property.name: MULTICHANNEL
property.shortdesc: Image with multiple color channels.

property.name: DUOTONE
property.shortdesc: Duotone mode, which creates monotone, duotone (two-color), tritone (three-color), and quadtone (four-color) grayscale images using one to four custom inks.

classdef.name: ChangeMode
classdef.shortdesc: The destination color mode. Note: Color images must be changed to Grayscale mode before you can change them to Bitmap mode.

property.name: GRAYSCALE
property.shortdesc: Grayscale.

property.name: RGB
property.shortdesc: RGB.

property.name: CMYK
property.shortdesc: CMYK.

property.name: LAB
property.shortdesc: Lab.

property.name: BITMAP
property.shortdesc: Bitmap. Note: Color images must be changed to Grayscale mode before you can change them to Bitmap mode.

property.name: INDEXEDCOLOR
property.shortdesc: Indexed color, in which the number of colors in the image is reduced to at most 256, the standard number of colors supported by the GIF and PNG-8 formats and many multimedia applications.
property.description: This conversion reduces file size by deleting color information from the image. To convert to indexed color, you must start with an image that is 8 bits per channel and in either Grayscale or RGB mode.

property.name: MULTICHANNEL
property.shortdesc: Image with multiple color channels.
property.description: Uses 256 levels of gray in each channel. Useful for specialized printing. Color channels in the original image become spot color channels in the converted image. A CMYK image converted to Multichannel mode creates cyan, magenta, yellow, and black spot channels. An RGB image converted Multichannel mode creates cyan, magenta, and yellow spot channels. The new grayscale information is based on the color values of the pixels in each channel. Multichannel mode images can be saved in Photoshop, Photoshop 2.0, Photoshop Raw, or Photoshop DCS 2.0 format. To export a multichannel image, save it in Photoshop DCS 2.0 format.

classdef.name: Intent
classdef.shortdesc: The color conversion intent.

property.name: PERCEPTUAL
property.shortdesc: Gives priority to colors for which the human eye has greater sensitivity.
property.description: Suitable for photographic images with a lot of out of gamut colors. This is the standard rendering intent for the Japanese printing industry.

property.name: SATURATION
property.shortdesc: Tries to produce vivid colors in an image at the expense of color accuracy.
property.description: Suitable for business graphics like graphs or charts, where bright saturated colors are more important than the exact relationship between colors.

property.name: RELATIVECOLORIMETRIC
property.shortdesc: Compares the extreme highlight of the source color space to that of the destination color space and shifts all colors accordingly. Out of gamut colors are shifted to the closest reproducible color in the destination color space.
property.description: The standard rendering intent for printing in North America and Europe.

property.name: ABSOLUTECOLORIMETRIC
property.shortdesc: Aims to maintain color accuracy at the expense of preserving relationships between colors and is suitable for proofing to simulate the output of a particular device. This intent is particularly useful for previewing how paper color affects printed colors.
property.description: Leaves colors that fall inside the destination gamut unchanged. Out of gamut colors are clipped. No scaling of colors to destination white point is performed.

property.name: VERTICAL

property.name: ALLCACHES

classdef.name: ResampleMethod
classdef.shortdesc: The method to use to resample the image.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: Does not resample.

property.name: NEARESTNEIGHBOR
property.shortdesc: Chooses a pixel in the center of the sample area and replaces the entire area with that pixel color. Same as subsampling.
property.description: Significantly reduces the conversion time compared with downsampling but results in images that are less smooth and continuous.

property.name: BILINEAR
property.shortdesc: Averages the pixels in a sample area and replaces the entire area with the average pixel color at the specified resolution. Same as average downsampling.

property.name: BICUBIC
property.shortdesc: Uses a weighted average to determine pixel color, which usually yields better results than the simple averageing method of downsampling.
property.description: The slowest but most precise method, resulting in the smoothest gradations.

property.name: BICUBICSHARPER
property.shortdesc: A good method for reducing the size of an image based on Bicubic interpolation with enhanced sharpening. Maintains the detail in a resampled image.

property.name: BICUBICSMOOTHER
property.shortdesc: A good method for enlarging images based on Bicubic interpolation but designed to produce smoother results.

classdef.name: OperatingSystem
classdef.shortdesc: The operating system.

property.name: OS2
property.shortdesc: Mac OS/2 operating system.

property.name: WINDOWS
property.shortdesc: Windows operating system.

classdef.name: ForcedColors
classdef.shortdesc: The colors whose inclusion to force in the color table.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: No forced colors.

property.name: BLACKWHITE
property.shortdesc: Forces pure black and white.

property.name: PRIMARIES
property.shortdesc: Forces red, green, blue, cyan, magenta, yellow, black, and white.

property.name: WEB
property.shortdesc: Forces the 216 web-safe colors.

classdef.name: PaletteType
classdef.shortdesc: The palette type for converting an image to indexed color.

property.name: EXACT
property.shortdesc: The palette uses the exact colors appearing in the RGB image; available only if the image uses 256 or fewer colors.
property.description: Because the image's palette contains all colors in the image, there is no dithering.

property.name: MACOSPALETTE
property.shortdesc: The Mac OS default 8-bit palette, whch is based on a uniform sampling of RGB colors.

property.name: WINDOWSPALETTE
property.shortdesc: The Windows system's default 8-bit palette, whch is based on a uniform sampling of RGB colors.

property.name: WEBPALETTE
property.shortdesc: The 216-color palette that web browsers, regardless of platform, use to display images on a monitor limited to 256 colors.
property.description: A subset of the Mac OS 8-bit palette. Use this option to avoid browser dither when viewing images on a monitor display limited to 256 colors.

property.name: UNIFORM
property.shortdesc: Creates a palette by uniformly sampling colors from the RGB color cube.
property.description: For example, if Photoshop takes six evenly spaced color levels each of red, green, and blue, the combination produces a uniform palette of 216 colors (6 cubed = 6 x 6 x 6 = 216). The total number of colors displayed in an image corresponds to the nearest perfect cube (8, 27, 64, 125, or 216) that is less than the value in the Colors text box.

property.name: LOCALPERCEPTUAL
property.shortdesc: Creates a custom palette by giving priority to colors for in the image which the human eye has greater sensitivity.

property.name: LOCALSELECTIVE
property.shortdesc: Creates a color table similar to the Perceptual color table, but favoring broad areas of color in the image and the preservation of web colors.
property.description: Usually produces images with the greatest color integrity.

property.name: LOCALADAPTIVE
property.shortdesc: Creates a palette by sampling the colors from the spectrum appearing most commonly in the image.
property.description: For example, an RGB image with only the colors green and blue produces a palette made primarily of greens and blues.

property.name: MASTERPERCEPTUAL
property.shortdesc: Creates a custom palette by giving priority to colors in a group of open images with the same color palette for which the human eye has greater sensitivity.

property.name: MASTERSELECTIVE
property.shortdesc: Creates a color table similar to the Master Perceptual color table, but favoring broad areas of color and the preservation of web colors.

property.name: MASTERADAPTIVE
property.shortdesc: Creates a palette by sampling the colors from the spectrum appearing most commonly in a group of open images that share the same color palette.

property.name: PREVIOUSPALETTE
property.shortdesc: Uses the custom palette from the previous conversion, making it easy to convert several images with the same custom palette.

classdef.name: DitherType
classdef.shortdesc: The type of dither.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: No dither is used.

property.name: DIFFUSION
property.shortdesc: Diffuses dither effects in random patterns across adjacent pixels.

property.name: PATTERN
property.shortdesc: Applies a halftone-like square pattern.

property.name: NOISE
property.shortdesc: Applies a random pattern but without diffusing the pattern across adjacent pixels; prevents the appearance of seams.

classdef.name: MacPreviewType
classdef.shortdesc: The type of image to use as a low-resolution preview in the destination application.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: Does not use a preview.

property.name: MONOCHROMETIFF
property.shortdesc: Monochrome TIFF.

property.name: EIGHTBITTIFF
property.shortdesc: 8-bit TIFF.

property.name: MACOSMONOCHROME
property.shortdesc: Monochrome.

property.name: MACOSEIGHTBIT
property.shortdesc: 8-bit.

property.name: MACOSJPEG
property.shortdesc: JPEG.

property.name: JPEG

property.name: PDFZIP4BIT

property.name: JPEGHIGH

property.name: JPEGMEDHIGH

property.name: JPEGMED
property.shortdesc: JPEG compression with medium image quality.

property.name: JPEGMEDLOW
property.shortdesc: JPEG compression with medium low image quality.

property.name: JPEGLOW
property.shortdesc: JPEG compression with low image quality.

property.name: JPEG2000HIGH
property.shortdesc: JPEG2000 compression with high image quality.

property.name: JPEG2000MEDHIGH
property.shortdesc: JPEG2000 compression with medium high image quality.

property.name: JPEG2000MED
property.shortdesc: JPEG2000 compression with medium image quality.

property.name: JPEG2000MEDLOW
property.shortdesc: JPEG2000 compression with medium low image quality.

property.name: JPEG2000LOW

property.name: JPEG2000LOSSLESS
property.shortdesc: JPEG2000 lossless compression.

classdef.name: PDFStandardType
classdef.shortdesc: The PDF/X standard with which the document complies.
classdef.description: PDF/X compliant files must contain information describing the printing condition for which they are prepared.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: The document does not use the PDF/X standard.

property.name: PDFX1A2001
property.shortdesc: PDF/X-1a standard, which requires all fonts to be embedded, the appropriate PDF bounding boxes to be specified, and color to appear as CMYK, spot colors, or both; can be opened in Acrobat 4.0 and Acrobat Reader 4.0 and later.

property.name: PDFX1A2003
property.shortdesc: PDF/X-1a standard, which requires all fonts to be embedded, the appropriate PDF bounding boxes to be specified, and color to appear as CMYK, spot colors, or both; can be opened in Acrobat 4.0 and Acrobat Reader 4.0 and later.

property.name: PDFX32002
property.shortdesc: PDF/X-3 standard, which requires all fonts to be embedded and the appropriate PDF bounding boxes to be specified, and for color allows either the use of color management and device-independent color (CIE L*a*b, ICC-based color spaces, CalRGB, and CalGray) or CMYK, spot colors, or both; can be opened in Acrobat 4.0 and Acrobat Reader 4.0 and later.

property.name: PDFX32003
property.shortdesc: PDF/X-3 standard, which requires all fonts to be embedded and the appropriate PDF bounding boxes to be specified, and for color allows either the use of color management and device-independent color (CIE L*a*b, ICC-based color spaces, CalRGB, and CalGray) or CMYK, spot colors, or both; can be opened in Acrobat 4.0 and Acrobat Reader 4.0 and later.

property.name: PDFX42008
property.shortdesc: PDF/X-4 standard, which requires all fonts to be embedded and the appropriate PDF bounding boxes to be specified, and for color allows either the use of color management and device-independent color (CIE L*a*b, ICC-based color spaces, CalRGB, and CalGray) or CMYK, spot colors, or both; can be opened in Acrobat 8.0 and Acrobat Reader 8.0 and later.

classdef.name: PDFCompatibilityType
classdef.shortdesc: The PDF version with which to make the document compatible.

property.name: PDF13
property.shortdesc: PDF 1.3 (Acrobat 4 or higher).

property.name: PDF14
property.shortdesc: PDF 1.4 (Acrobat 5 or higher).

property.name: PDF15
property.shortdesc: PDF 1.5 (Acrobat 6 or higher).

property.name: PDF16
property.shortdesc: PDF 1.6 (Acrobat 7 or higher)

property.name: PDF17
property.shortdesc: PDF 1.7 (Acrobat 9 or higher)

classdef.name: PDFResampleType
classdef.shortdesc: Downsampling options when saving as PDF.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: Does not downsample.

property.name: PDFAVERAGE
property.shortdesc: Averages the pixels in a sample area and replaces the entire area with the average pixel color at the specified resolution.

property.name: PDFSUBSAMPLE
property.shortdesc: Chooses a pixel in the center of the sample area and replaces the entire area with that pixel color; significantly reduces conversion time but results in images that are less smooth and continuous.

property.name: PDFBICUBIC
property.shortdesc: Uses a weighted average to determine pixel color, which usually yields better results than the simple averaging method of downsampling. The slowest but most precise method, resulting in the smoothest gradations.

classdef.name: PICTCompression
classdef.shortdesc: The compression type to use whan saving as PICT.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: No compression.

property.name: JPEGLOWPICT
property.shortdesc: Low quality JPEG encoding (high amount of compression).

property.name: JPEGMEDIUMPICT
property.shortdesc: Medium quality JPEG encoding (medium amount of compression).

property.name: JPEGHIGHPICT
property.shortdesc: High quality JPEG encoding.

property.name: JPEGMAXIMUMPICT
property.shortdesc: Maximum quality JPEG encoding (very little compression).

classdef.name: MacExtensionType
classdef.shortdesc: The formatting for the filename extension.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: Does not use an extension.

property.name: LOWERCASE
property.shortdesc: The extension is in lowercase letters.

property.name: UPPERCASE
property.shortdesc: The extension is in uppercase letters.

classdef.name: TiffEncodingType
classdef.shortdesc: The encoding to use when saving to TIFF format.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: No compression.

property.name: TIFFLZW
property.shortdesc: LZW compression, which is lossless and most useful for images with large areas of single color.

property.name: JPEG
property.shortdesc: JPEG compression, which is lossy and recommended for continuous-tone images, such as photographs.

property.name: TIFFZIP
property.shortdesc: Zip compression, which is lossless and most effective for images that contain large areas of single color.

classdef.name: LayerCompressionType
classdef.shortdesc: The layer compression type.

property.name: RLE
property.shortdesc: Run Length Encoding, which is lossless.

property.name: ZIP
property.shortdesc: Zip compression, which is lossless and most effective for images that contain large areas of single color.

classdef.name: ByteOrderType
classdef.shortdesc: The platform-specific order in which bytes will be read.

property.name: IBM
property.shortdesc: IBM PC.

property.name: MACOS
property.shortdesc: Mac OS.

classdef.name: DCSType
classdef.shortdesc: The DCS format.

property.name: NOCOMPOSITE
property.shortdesc: Does not create a composite file.

property.name: GRAYSCALECOMPOSITE
property.shortdesc: Creates a grayscale composite file in addition to DCS files.

property.name: COLORCOMPOSITE
property.shortdesc: Creates a color composite file in addition to DCS files.

classdef.name: TrimType
classdef.shortdesc: The type of pixels to trim around an image.

property.name: TRANSPARENT
property.shortdesc: Trims away transparency at the edges of the image, leaving the smallest image containing nontransparent pixels.

property.name: TOPLEFT
property.shortdesc: Removes from the image an area the color of the upper left pixel.

property.name: BOTTOMRIGHT
property.shortdesc: Removes from the image an area the color of the lower right pixel.

property.name: WINDOWS

property.name: PLUGIN

classdef.name: ResetTarget
classdef.shortdesc: The type of object(s) to reset to default settings.

property.name: ALLWARNINGS
property.shortdesc: Warning dialogs.

property.name: ALLTOOLS
property.shortdesc: Tools.

property.name: EVERYTHING
property.shortdesc: All targets.

classdef.name: SaveBehavior
classdef.shortdesc: The application's behavior regarding image previews and file extensions when a save method is called.

property.name: NEVERSAVE
property.shortdesc: Never save the item with the file.

property.name: ALWAYSSAVE
property.shortdesc: Always save the item with the file.

property.name: ASKWHENSAVING
property.shortdesc: Prompt the user whether to save the item with the file.

classdef.name: PaintingCursors
classdef.shortdesc: The pointer for the following tools: Marquee, Lasso, Polygonal Lasso, Magic Wand, Crop, Slice, Patch Eyedropper, Pen, Gradient, Line, Paint Bucket, Magnetic Lasso, Magnetic Pen, Freeform Pen, Measure, and Color Sampler.

property.name: STANDARD
property.shortdesc: Displays pointers as tool icons.

property.name: PRECISE
property.shortdesc: Displays pointers as cross hairs.

property.name: BRUSHSIZE
property.shortdesc: Displays cursors as brush shapes representing the size of the current brush. Valid only for painting cursors.
property.description: Brush size cursors may not appear for very large brushes.

property.name: SOLID

property.name: DASHED
property.shortdesc: Dashed.

classdef.name: BlendMode
classdef.shortdesc: Controls how pixels in the image are blended.

property.name: PASSTHROUGH
property.shortdesc: Allows any blend modes, advanced blending options, and opacity and fill values applied to layers within a set to affect layers below the set in the Layers palette.
property.description: Valid only for layer sets. To restrict blend modes of the layers within a set, change the layer set's blend mode to Normal.

property.name: NORMAL
property.shortdesc: Edits or paints each pixel to make it the result color. (Called "Threshold" when you’re working with a bitmapped or indexed-color image.)

property.name: DISSOLVE
property.shortdesc: Edits or paints each pixel to make it the result color. However, the result color is a random replacement of the pixels with the base color or the blend color, depending on the opacity at any pixel location.

property.name: DARKEN
property.shortdesc: Looks at the color information in each channel and selects the base or blend color—whichever is darker—as the result color. Pixels lighter than the blend color are replaced, and pixels darker than the blend color do not change.

property.name: MULTIPLY
property.shortdesc: Looks at the color information in each channel and multiplies the base color by the blend color. The result color is always a darker color. Multiplying any color with black produces black. Multiplying any color with white leaves the color unchanged. When you’re painting with a color other than black or white, successive strokes with a painting tool produce progressively darker colors. The effect is similar to drawing on the image with multiple marking pens.

property.name: COLORBURN
property.shortdesc: Looks at the color information in each channel and darkens the base color to reflect the blend color by increasing the contrast. Blending with white produces no change.

property.name: LINEARBURN
property.shortdesc: Looks at the color information in each channel and darkens the base color to reflect the blend color by decreasing the brightness. Blending with white produces no change.

property.name: LIGHTEN
property.shortdesc: Looks at the color information in each channel and selects the base or blend color—whichever is lighter—as the result color. Pixels darker than the blend color are replaced, and pixels lighter than the blend color do not change.

property.name: SCREEN
property.shortdesc: Looks at each channel’s color information and multiplies the inverse of the blend and base colors. The result color is always a lighter color. Screening with black leaves the color unchanged. Screening with white produces white. The effect is similar to projecting multiple photographic slides on top of each other.

property.name: COLORDODGE
property.shortdesc: Looks at the color information in each channel and brightens the base color to reflect the blend color by decreasing the contrast. Blending with black produces no change.

property.name: LINEARDODGE
property.shortdesc: Looks at the color information in each channel and brightens the base color to reflect the blend color by increasing the brightness. Blending with black produces no change.

property.name: OVERLAY
property.shortdesc: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the base color. Patterns or colors overlay the existing pixels while preserving the highlights and shadows of the base color. The base color is not replaced but is mixed with the blend color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the original color.

property.name: SOFTLIGHT
property.shortdesc: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the blend color. The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the image. If the blend color (light source) is lighter than 50% gray, the image is lightened as if it were dodged. If the blend color is darker than 50% gray, the image is darkened as if it were burned in. Painting with pure black or white produces a distinctly darker or lighter area but does not result in pure black or white.

property.name: HARDLIGHT
property.shortdesc: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the blend color. The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the image. If the blend color (light source) is lighter than 50% gray, the image is lightened, as if it were screened. This is useful for adding highlights to an image. If the blend color is darker than 50% gray, the image is darkened, as if it were multiplied. This is useful for adding shadows to an image. Painting with pure black or white results in pure black or white.

property.name: VIVIDLIGHT
property.shortdesc: Burns or dodges the colors by increasing or decreasing the contrast, depending on the blend color. If the blend color (light source) is lighter than 50% gray, the image is lightened by decreasing the contrast. If the blend color is darker than 50% gray, the image is darkened by increasing the contrast.

property.name: LINEARLIGHT
property.shortdesc: Burns or dodges the colors by decreasing or increasing the brightness, depending on the blend color. If the blend color (light source) is lighter than 50% gray, the image is lightened by increasing the brightness. If the blend color is darker than 50% gray, the image is darkened by decreasing the brightness.

property.name: PINLIGHT
property.shortdesc: Replaces the colors, depending on the blend color. If the blend color (light source) is lighter than 50% gray, pixels darker than the blend color are replaced, and pixels lighter than the blend color do not change. If the blend color is darker than 50% gray, pixels lighter than the blend color are replaced, and pixels darker than the blend color do not change. This is useful for adding special effects to an image.

property.name: DIFFERENCE
property.shortdesc: Looks at the color information in each channel and subtracts either the blend color from the base color or the base color from the blend color, depending on which has the greater brightness value. Blending with white inverts the base color values; blending with black produces no change.

property.name: EXCLUSION
property.shortdesc: Creates an effect similar to but lower in contrast than the Difference mode. Blending with white inverts the base color values. Blending with black produces no change.

property.name: HUE
property.shortdesc: Creates a result color with the luminance and saturation of the base color and the hue of the blend color.

property.name: SATURATION
property.shortdesc: Creates a result color with the luminance and hue of the base color and the saturation of the blend color. Painting with this mode in an area with no (0) saturation (gray) causes no change.

property.name: COLORBLEND
property.shortdesc: Creates a result color with the luminance of the base color and the hue and saturation of the blend color. This preserves the gray levels in the image and is useful for coloring monochrome images and for tinting color images.

property.name: LUMINOSITY
property.shortdesc: Creates a result color with the hue and saturation of the base color and the luminance of the blend color. This mode creates an inverse effect from that of the Color mode.

property.name: HARDMIX
property.shortdesc: Lighter colors lighten the result, and darker colors darken the result. 50% gray as a blend color has no effect on the result color. Lowering the fill opacity creates less posterization/thresholding.

property.name: LIGHTERCOLOR
property.shortdesc: Lighter colors lighten the result, and darker colors darken the result. 50% gray as a blend color has no effect on the result color. Lowering the fill opacity creates less posterization/thresholding.

property.name: DARKERCOLOR
property.shortdesc: Lighter colors lighten the result, and darker colors darken the result. 50% gray as a blend color has no effect on the result color. Lowering the fill opacity creates less posterization/thresholding.

classdef.name: ColorBlendMode
classdef.shortdesc: The color blend mode type.

property.name: NORMAL
property.shortdesc: Edits or paints each pixel to make it the result color. (Called "Threshold" when you’re working with a bitmapped or indexed-color image.)

property.name: DISSOLVE
property.shortdesc: Edits or paints each pixel to make it the result color, which is a random replacement of the pixels with the base color or the blend color, depending on the opacity at any pixel location.

property.name: BEHIND
property.shortdesc: Edits or paints only on the transparent part of a layer. Works only in layers in which transparent pixels locked = false and is analogous to painting on the back of transparent areas on a sheet of acetate.

property.name: CLEAR
property.shortdesc: Edits or paints each pixel and makes it transparent. Works only in layers in which transparent pixels locked = false.

property.name: DARKEN
property.shortdesc: Looks at the color information in each channel and selects the base or blend color—whichever is darker—as the result color. Pixels lighter than the blend color are replaced, and pixels darker than the blend color do not change.

Screening with black leaves the color unchanged. Screening with white produces white. The effect is similar to projecting multiple photographic slides on top of each other.

property.name: LINEARDODGE

property.name: OVERLAY

The base color is not replaced but is mixed with the blend color to reflect the lightness or darkness of the original color.

property.name: SOFTLIGHT

Painting with pure black or white produces a distinctly darker or lighter area but does not result in pure black or white.

property.name: HARDLIGHT

If the blend color is darker than 50% gray, the image is darkened, as if it were multiplied. This is useful for adding shadows to an image. property.name: VIVIDLIGHT
property.shortdesc: Burns or dodges the colors by increasing or decreasing the contrast, depending on the blend color. If the blend color is darker than 50% gray, the image is darkened by increasing the contrast.

property.name: LINEARLIGHT
property.shortdesc: Burns or dodges the colors by decreasing or increasing the brightness, depending on the blend color. If the blend color (light source) is lighter than 50% gray, the image is lightened by increasing the brightness. If the blend color is darker than 50% gray, the image is darkened by decreasing the brightness.

property.name: PINLIGHT
property.shortdesc: Replaces the colors, depending on the blend color. If the blend color (light source) is lighter than 50% gray, pixels darker than the blend color are replaced, and pixels lighter than the blend color do not change. If the blend color is darker than 50% gray, pixels lighter than the blend color are replaced, and pixels darker than the blend color do not change. property.name: DIFFERENCE

property.name: HUE
property.shortdesc: Creates a result color with the luminance and saturation of the base color and the hue of the blend color.

property.name: SATURATION
property.shortdesc: Creates a result color with the luminance and hue of the base color and the saturation of the blend color. Painting with this mode in an area with no (0) saturation (gray) causes no change.

property.name: COLOR
property.shortdesc: Creates a result color with the luminance of the base color and the hue and saturation of the blend color. This preserves the gray levels in the image and is useful for coloring monochrome images and for tinting color images.

classdef.name: RasterizeType
classdef.shortdesc: The type of the layer content to rasterize.

property.name: TEXTCONTENTS
property.shortdesc: Rasterizes the type on a type layer. Doesn't rasterize any other vector data on the layer.

property.name: SHAPE
property.shortdesc: Rasterizes a shape layer.

property.name: FILLCONTENT
property.shortdesc: Rasterizes the fill of a shape layer, leaving the vector mask.

property.name: LAYERCLIPPINGPATH
property.shortdesc: Rasterizes the vector mask of a shape layer, turning it into a layer mask.

property.name: ENTIRELAYER
property.shortdesc: Rasterizes all vector data on the layer.

property.name: LINKEDLAYERS
property.shortdesc: Rasterizes the selected layers.

classdef.name: Justification
classdef.shortdesc: The placement of paragraph text within the bounding box.

property.name: LEFT
property.shortdesc: Aligns the left edges, leaving the right edge ragged.

property.name: CENTER
property.shortdesc: Text is centered on each line.

property.name: RIGHT
property.shortdesc: Aligns the right edges, leaving the left edge ragged.

property.name: LEFTJUSTIFIED
property.shortdesc: Justifies all lines except the last, which is left-aligned.

property.name: CENTERJUSTIFIED
property.shortdesc: Justifies all lines except the last, which is center-aligned.

property.name: RIGHTJUSTIFIED
property.shortdesc: Justifies all lines except the last, which is right-aligned.

property.name: FULLYJUSTIFIED
property.shortdesc: Justifies all lines including the last, which is force-justified.

classdef.name: AntiAlias
classdef.shortdesc: The method to use to smooth edges by softening the color transition between edge pixels and background pixels.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: Does not use anti-aliasing.

property.name: SHARP
property.shortdesc: Makes type appear its sharpest.

property.name: CRISP
property.shortdesc: Makes type appear somewhat sharp.

property.name: STRONG
property.shortdesc: Makes type appear heavier.

property.name: SMOOTH
property.shortdesc: Makes type appear smoother.

classdef.name: Case

property.name: NORMAL

property.name: ALLCAPS

property.name: SMALLCAPS

property.name: NYNORSKNORWEGIAN

property.name: PORTUGUESE
property.shortdesc: Portuguese.

property.name: BRAZILLIANPORTUGUESE

property.name: SPANISH
property.shortdesc: Spanish.

property.name: SWEDISH
property.shortdesc: Swedish.

property.name: DUTCH
property.shortdesc: Dutch.

property.name: DANISH
property.shortdesc: Danish.

classdef.name: TextType
classdef.shortdesc: The type of text.

property.name: POINTTEXT
property.shortdesc: Text that does not wrap.

property.name: PARAGRAPHTEXT
property.shortdesc: Text that wraps within a bounding box.

classdef.name: WarpStyle
classdef.shortdesc: The warp style for text.

property.name: NONE
property.shortdesc: No warp.

property.name: ARC
property.shortdesc: The type is warped in the shape of an arc.

property.name: ARCLOWER
property.shortdesc: Warp is heavier on the lower or left edge of the text than on the upper or right edge.

property.name: ARCUPPER
property.shortdesc: Warp is heavier on the upper or right edge of the text than on the lower or left edge.

property.name: ARCH
property.shortdesc: Text is warped in the form of an arch.

property.name: BULGE
property.shortdesc: Text is warped outward on both the upper and lower or right and left edges.

property.name: SHELLLOWER
property.shortdesc: Text is warped downward or to the right in the shape of a fan-like seashell.

property.name: SHELLUPPER
property.shortdesc: Text is warped upward or to the left in the shape of a fan-like seashell.

property.name: FLAG
property.shortdesc: Text is warped in the shape of a waving flag.

property.name: WAVE
property.shortdesc: Text is warped in the shape of a wave.

property.name: FISH
property.shortdesc: Text is warped in the shape of a fish.

property.name: RISE
property.shortdesc: Text is warped in an undulating, rising pattern.

property.name: FISHEYE
property.shortdesc: Text bulges in the middle and is squeezed on the edges as if viewed through a fisheye lens.

property.name: INFLATE
property.shortdesc: Text is inflated.

property.name: SQUEEZE
property.shortdesc: Text is squeezed.

property.name: TWIST
property.shortdesc: Text is twisted.

classdef.name: TextComposer
classdef.shortdesc: The text composer.

property.name: ADOBESINGLELINE
property.shortdesc: Offers a traditional approach to composing type one line at a time. Useful if you prefer to have manual control over how lines break.
property.description: Uses the following principles when considering a breakpoint: Compressed or expanded word spacing is preferable to hyphenation; Hyphenation is preferable to compressed or expanded letter spacing; If spacing must be adjusted, compression is better than expansion.

property.name: ADOBEEVERYLINE
property.shortdesc: Considers a network of break points for a range of lines and thus optimizes earlier lines in the paragraph to eliminate especially unattractive breaks later on. Results in more even spacing and fewer hyphens.
property.description: The Adobe Every-line composer approaches composition by identifying possible breakpoints, evaluating them, and assigning a weighted penalty based on these principles: Highest importance is given to evenness of letter and word spacing; Possible breakpoints are evaluated and penalized according to how much they deviate from optimal spacing; Hyphenation is avoided when possible; Breakpoints that require hyphenation are penalized more than those that create uneven spacing; Good breakpoints are preferred over bad breakpoints.

classdef.name: AutoKernType
classdef.shortdesc: The type of kerning to use for characters.

property.name: MANUAL
property.shortdesc: Allows manual kerning.

property.name: METRICS
property.shortdesc: Uses kern pairs, which contain information about the spacing of specific pairs of letters.

property.name: OPTICAL
property.shortdesc: Adjusts the spacing between adjacent characters based on their shapes.

classdef.name: StrikeThruType
classdef.shortdesc: The strikethrough style.

property.name: STRIKEOFF
property.shortdesc: No strikethrough.

property.name: STRIKEHEIGHT
property.shortdesc: (For vertical type) The strikethrough is through the height of the text.

property.name: STRIKEBOX
property.shortdesc: (For vertical type) The strikethrough is through the em box.

classdef.name: UnderlineType
classdef.shortdesc: The type of underline.

property.name: UNDERLINEOFF
property.shortdesc: No underline.

property.name: UNDERLINERIGHT
property.shortdesc: (For vertical type) The underline is to the right of the text.

property.name: UNDERLINELEFT
property.shortdesc: (For vertical type) The underline is to the left of the text.

classdef.name: SelectionType
classdef.shortdesc: The selection behavior when a selection already exists.

property.name: REPLACE
property.shortdesc: Replace the selected area.

property.name: EXTEND
property.shortdesc: Add the selection to an already selected area.

property.name: DIMINISH
property.shortdesc: Remove the selection from the already selected area.

property.name: INTERSECT
property.shortdesc: Make the selection only the area where the new selection intersects the already selected area.

classdef.name: ExportType

property.name: ILLUSTRATORPATHS
property.shortdesc: Exports Photoshop paths as Adobe Illustrator files.

property.name: SAVEFORWEB
property.shortdesc: Uses the save for web export options.

classdef.name: IllustratorPathType

property.name: DOCUMENTBOUNDS
property.shortdesc: Exports the document bounds.

property.name: ALLPATHS
property.shortdesc: Exports all paths.

property.name: NAMEDPATH
property.shortdesc: Exports the specified path. To specify the path, see the path name property of the illustrator export options object.

classdef.name: ChannelType
classdef.shortdesc: The type of channel.

property.name: COMPONENT
property.shortdesc: The channel related to the document color model.

property.name: MASKEDAREA
property.shortdesc: The apha channel where color indicates a masked area.

property.name: SELECTEDAREA
property.shortdesc: The lpha channel where color indicates a selected area.

property.name: SPOTCOLOR
property.shortdesc: The alpha channel to store a spot color.

classdef.name: RadialBlurMethod
classdef.shortdesc: The blur method to use.

property.name: SPIN
property.shortdesc: Blurs along concentric circular lines at the specified degree of rotation.

property.name: ZOOM
property.shortdesc: Blurs along radial lines, as if zooming into or out of the image.

classdef.name: RadialBlurQuality
classdef.shortdesc: The radial blur quality.

property.name: DRAFT
property.shortdesc: Produces fast but grainy results.

property.name: GOOD
property.shortdesc: Produces good results.

property.name: BEST
property.shortdesc: Produces best results.

classdef.name: SmartBlurQuality
classdef.shortdesc: The smart blur quality.

property.name: LOW
property.shortdesc: Low quality.

property.name: MEDIUM
property.shortdesc: Medium quality.

property.name: HIGH
property.shortdesc: High quality.

classdef.name: SmartBlurMode
classdef.shortdesc: The method to use for smart blurring.

property.name: NORMAL
property.shortdesc: Blur is applied to entire image.

property.name: EDGEONLY
property.shortdesc: Blur is applied only to edges of color transitions.
property.description: Where significant contrast occurs, applies black-and-white edges.

property.name: OVERLAYEDGE
property.shortdesc: Blur is applied only to edges of color transitions.
property.description: Where significant contrast occurs, applies white edges.

classdef.name: TextureType
classdef.shortdesc: The type of texture or glass surface image to load for a texturizer or glass filter.

property.name: BLOCKS
property.shortdesc: The image appears as if viewed through glass blocks.

property.name: CANVAS
property.shortdesc: The image appears as if painted on canvas.

property.name: FROSTED
property.shortdesc: The image appears as if frosted.

property.name: TINYLENS
property.shortdesc: The image appears as if viewed through an array of tiny lenses.

property.name: FILE
property.shortdesc: Texture from an existing document.

classdef.name: PolarConversionType
classdef.shortdesc: The method of polar distortion to use.

property.name: RECTANGULARTOPOLAR
property.shortdesc: The selection is converted from its rectangular to polar coordinates.

property.name: POLARTORECTANGULAR
property.shortdesc: The selection is converted from its polar to rectangular coordinates.

classdef.name: RippleSize
classdef.shortdesc: The size of undulations.

property.name: SMALL
property.shortdesc: Small.

property.name: MEDIUM
property.shortdesc: Medium.

property.name: LARGE
property.shortdesc: Large.

classdef.name: UndefinedAreas
classdef.shortdesc: The method to use to treat undistorted areas or areas left blank in an image to which a filter in the Distort category has been applied.

property.name: WRAPAROUND
property.shortdesc: Fills the undefined space with content from the opposite edge of the image.

property.name: REPEATEDGEPIXELS
property.shortdesc: Extends the colors of pixels along the edge of the image in the direction specified. Banding may result if the edge pixels are different colors.

classdef.name: OffsetUndefinedAreas
classdef.shortdesc: The method to use to fill the empty space left by offsetting a an image or selection.

property.name: SETTOBACKGROUND
property.shortdesc: For background layers, sets pixels to the background layer color. For nonbackground layers, sets the pixels to transparent.

property.name: WRAPAROUND
property.shortdesc: Fills the undefined space with content from the opposite edge of the image.

property.name: REPEATEDGEPIXELS
property.shortdesc: Extends the colors of pixels along the edge of the image in the direction specified. Banding may result if the edge pixels are different colors.

classdef.name: SpherizeMode
classdef.shortdesc: The curve (or stretch shape) to use for the distortion.

property.name: NORMAL
property.shortdesc: Distorts the image as if it is wrapped around a sphere.

property.name: HORIZONTAL
property.shortdesc: Distorts the image as if it is wrapped around a horizontal cylinder.

property.name: VERTICAL
property.shortdesc: Distorts the image as if it is wrapped around a vertical cylinder.

classdef.name: DisplacementMapType
classdef.shortdesc: Describes how the displacement map fits the image if the image is not the same size as the map.

classdef.name: OpenOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options that can be specified when opening a document.

classdef.name: PhotoCDOpenOptions
classdef.shortdesc: DEPRECATED.

property.name: pixelSize
property.shortdesc: The dimensions of the image.

property.name: colorProfileName
property.shortdesc: The profile to use when reading the image.

property.name: resolution
property.shortdesc: The resolution of the image (in pixels per inch)

property.name: colorSpace
property.shortdesc: The color space for the image.

property.name: orientation
property.shortdesc: The image orientation.

classdef.name: RawFormatOpenOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options that can be specified when opening a document in RAW format.

property.name: height
property.shortdesc: The image height (in pixels)

property.name: width
property.shortdesc: The image width (in pixels)

property.name: channelNumber
property.shortdesc: The number of channels in the image. Valid only when 'bits per channel' = 16. Range: 1 to 56.

property.name: interleaveChannels
property.shortdesc: If true, color values are stored sequentially.

property.name: bitsPerChannel
property.shortdesc: The number of bits for each channel. Valid values: 8 or 16.

property.name: byteOrder
property.shortdesc: The order in which bytes will be read. Valid only when 'bits per channel' = 16.

property.name: headerSize
property.shortdesc: The number of bytes of information that will appear in the file before actual image information begins; that is, the number of zeroes inserted at the beginning of the file as placeholders. Range: 0 to 1919999.

property.name: retainHeader
property.shortdesc: If true, the header is retained when saving.

classdef.name: GenericPDFOpenOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options that can be specified when opening a generic PDF document.

property.name: resolution
property.shortdesc: The resolution of the document (in pixels per inch)

property.name: mode
property.shortdesc: The document mode.

property.name: antiAlias
property.shortdesc: If true, anti-aliasing is used.

property.name: page
property.shortdesc: The number of the page or image to open.

property.name: object
property.shortdesc: The number of the 3d object to open.

property.name: constrainProportions
property.shortdesc: DEPRECATED.

property.name: height
property.shortdesc: DEPRECATED.

property.name: width
property.shortdesc: DEPRECATED.

property.name: bitsPerChannel
property.shortdesc: The number of bits per channel.

property.name: usePageNumber
property.shortdesc: If true, the value specified in the page property refers to a page number. If false, the value specifies an image number.

property.name: use3DObjectNumber
property.shortdesc: If true, the value specified in the page property refers to a page number. If false, the value specifies an image number.

property.name: name
property.shortdesc: The name of the document.

property.name: cropPage
property.shortdesc: The cropping method to use.

property.name: suppressWarnings
property.shortdesc: If true, suppresses any warnings that may occur during opening.

classdef.name: GenericEPSOpenOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options that can be specified when opening a generic EPS document.

property.name: height
property.shortdesc: The image height.

property.name: width
property.shortdesc: The image width.

property.name: resolution
property.shortdesc: The resolution of the document (in pixels per inch)

property.name: mode
property.shortdesc: The document mode.

property.name: antiAlias
property.shortdesc: If true, anti-aliasing is used.

property.name: constrainProportions
property.shortdesc: If true, the image proportions are constrained.

classdef.name: DICOMOpenOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options for opening a DICOM document.

property.name: anonymize
property.shortdesc: If true, patient information is anonymized.

property.name: showOverlays
property.shortdesc: If true, overlays are shown (if present).

property.name: rows

property.name: columns
property.shortdesc: The number of columns in an n-up configuration.

property.name: windowWidth
property.shortdesc: The brightness of the image in Houndsfield units.

property.name: windowLevel
property.shortdesc: The contrast of the image in Houndsfield units.

property.name: reverse
property.shortdesc: If true, the image is inverted.

classdef.name: CameraRAWOpenOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options for opening a camera RAW document.

property.name: colorSpace
property.shortdesc: The image color space.

property.name: bitsPerChannel
property.shortdesc: The number of bits per channel.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The size of the new document.

property.name: resolution
property.shortdesc: The resolution of the document (in pixels per inch)

property.name: settings
property.shortdesc: The global settings for all Camera RAW options.

property.name: whiteBalance
property.shortdesc: The white balance options for the image.

property.name: temperature
property.shortdesc: The temperature of the shot. Range: 2000 to 50000.

property.name: tint
property.shortdesc: The tint of the shot. Range: -150 to 150.

property.name: exposure
property.shortdesc: The exposure of the shot. Range: -4.0 to 4.0.

property.name: shadows
property.shortdesc: The shadows of the shot. Range: 0 to 100.

property.name: brightness
property.shortdesc: The brightness of the shot. Range: 0 to 150.

property.name: contrast
property.shortdesc: The constrast of the shot. Range: -50 to 100.

property.name: saturation
property.shortdesc: The saturation of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: sharpness
property.shortdesc: The sharpness of the shot. Range: 0 to 100.

property.name: luminanceSmoothing
property.shortdesc: The luminance smoothing of the shot. Range: 0 to 100.

property.name: colorNoiseReduction
property.shortdesc: The color noise reduction of the shot. Range: 0 to 100.

property.name: chromaticAberrationRC
property.shortdesc: The chromatic aberration R/C of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: chromaticAberrationBY
property.shortdesc: The chromatic aberration B/Y of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: vignettingAmount
property.shortdesc: The vignetting amount of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: vignettingMidpoint
property.shortdesc: The vignetting mid point of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: shadowTint
property.shortdesc: The shadow tint of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: redHue
property.shortdesc: The red hue of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: redSaturation
property.shortdesc: The red saturation of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: greenHue
property.shortdesc: The green hue of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: greenSaturation
property.shortdesc: The green saturation of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: blueHue
property.shortdesc: The blue hue of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

property.name: blueSaturation
property.shortdesc: The blue saturation of the shot. Range: -100 to 100.

classdef.name: SaveOptions

property.name: SAVECHANGES
property.shortdesc: Save changes.

property.name: DONOTSAVECHANGES
property.shortdesc: Do not save changes.

property.name: PROMPTTOSAVECHANGES
property.shortdesc: Ask the user whether to save.

classdef.name: PhotoshopSaveOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options for saving a Photoshop document.

property.name: alphaChannels
property.shortdesc: If true, the alpha channels are saved.

property.name: layers
property.shortdesc: If true, the layers are saved.

property.name: annotations
property.shortdesc: If true, the annotations are saved.

property.name: spotColors
property.shortdesc: If true, spot colors are saved.

property.name: embedColorProfile
property.shortdesc: If true, the color profile is embedded in the document.

classdef.name: BMPSaveOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options for saving a document in BMP format.

property.name: alphaChannels
property.shortdesc: If true, the alpha channels are saved.

property.name: osType
property.shortdesc: The target operating system.

property.name: depth
property.shortdesc: The number of bits per sample.

property.name: rleCompression
property.shortdesc: If true, RLE compression is used.

property.name: flipRowOrder
property.shortdesc: If true, the image is written from bottom to top.

classdef.name: GIFSaveOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options for saving a document in GIF format.

property.name: colors
property.shortdesc: The number of colors in palette. Not valid for all palette types.

property.name: dither
property.shortdesc: The type of dither.

property.name: ditherAmount
property.shortdesc: The amount of dither. Valid only when 'dither type' is diffusion. Range: 1 to 100.

property.name: forced
property.shortdesc: The type of colors to force into the color palette.

property.name: interlaced
property.shortdesc: If true, rows are interlaced.

property.name: matte
property.shortdesc: The color to use to fill anti-aliased edges adjacent to transparent areas of the image. Default: white.

property.name: palette
property.shortdesc: The type of palette to use.

property.name: preserveExactColors
property.shortdesc: If true, protects colors in the image that contain entries in the color table from being dithered. Valid only when 'dither' = diffusion.

property.name: transparency
property.shortdesc: If true, preserves transparent ares of the image during GIF conversion.

classdef.name: EPSSaveOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options for saving a document in EPS format.

property.name: embedColorProfile
property.shortdesc: If true, the color profile is embedded in the document.

property.name: preview
property.shortdesc: The type of preview.

property.name: encoding
property.shortdesc: The type of encoding to use for the document.

property.name: halftoneScreen
property.shortdesc: If true, includes the halftone screen.

property.name: transferFunction
property.shortdesc: If true, includes the transfer functions in the document to compensate for dot gain between the image and film.

property.name: psColorManagement
property.shortdesc: If true, uses PostScript color management.

property.name: vectorData
property.shortdesc: If true, includes vector data. Valid only when the document contains vector data (un-rasterized text).

property.name: interpolation
property.shortdesc: If true, uses image interpolation.

property.name: transparentWhites
property.shortdesc: If true, displays white areas as transparent. Valid only for documents in BitMap mode.

classdef.name: JPEGSaveOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options for saving a document in JPEG format.

property.name: embedColorProfile
property.shortdesc: If true, the color profile is embedded in the document.

property.name: formatOptions
property.shortdesc: The download format to use.

property.name: matte
property.shortdesc: The color to use to fill anti-aliased edges adjacent to transparent areas of the image. Default: white.

property.name: scans
property.shortdesc: The number of scans. Valid only for progressive type JPEG files.

property.name: quality
property.shortdesc: The quality of the produced image.

classdef.name: PDFSaveOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options for saving a document in PDF format.

property.name: alphaChannels
property.shortdesc: If true, the alpha channels are saved.

property.name: layers
property.shortdesc: If true, the layers are saved.

property.name: annotations
property.shortdesc: If true, the annotations are saved.

property.name: spotColors
property.shortdesc: If true, the spot colors are saved.

property.name: embedColorProfile
property.shortdesc: If true, the color profile is embedded in the document.

property.name: downgradeColorProfile
property.shortdesc: DEPRECATED, ( should the embedded color profile be downgraded to version 2 )

property.name: transparency
property.shortdesc: DEPRECATED.

property.name: interpolation
property.shortdesc: DEPRECATED. ( use image interpolation? )

property.name: vectorData
property.shortdesc: DEPRECATED. ( include vector data )

property.name: embedFonts
property.shortdesc: DEPRECATED. ( embed fonts? Only valid if a text layer is included )

property.name: useOutlines
property.shortdesc: DEPRECATED. ( use outlines for text? Only valid if vector data is included )

property.name: encoding
property.shortdesc: The encoding method to use.

property.name: jpegQuality
property.shortdesc: The quality of the produced image. Valid only for JPEG-encoded PDF documents. Range: 0 to 12.

property.name: presetFile
property.shortdesc: The preset file to use for settings; overrides other settings.

property.name: PDFStandard
property.shortdesc: The PDF standard to make the document compatible with.

property.name: PDFCompatibility
property.shortdesc: The PDF version to make the document compatible with.

property.name: description
property.shortdesc: Description of the save options in use.

property.name: preserveEditing
property.shortdesc: If true, allows users to reopen the PDF in Photoshop with native Photoshop data intact.

property.name: embedThumbnail
property.shortdesc: If true, includes a small preview image in Acrobat.

property.name: optimizeForWeb
property.shortdesc: If true, improves performance of PDFs on Web servers.

property.name: view
property.shortdesc: If true, opens the saved PDF in Acrobat.

property.name: downSample
property.shortdesc: The downsample method to use.

property.name: downSampleSize
property.shortdesc: The size (in pixels per inch) to downsample images to if they exceed the value specified for 'down sample size limit'.

property.name: downSampleSizeLimit
property.shortdesc: Limits downsampling or subsampling to images that exceed this value (in pixels per inch).

property.name: tileSize
property.shortdesc: The compression option. Valid only when encoding is JPEG2000.

property.name: convertToEightBit
property.shortdesc: If true, converts a 16-bit image to 8-bit for better compatibility with other applications.

property.name: colorConversion
property.shortdesc: If true, converts the color profile to the destination profile.

property.name: destinationProfile
property.shortdesc: Describes the final RGB or CMYK output device, such as a monitor or press standard.

property.name: profileInclusionPolicy
property.shortdesc: If true, shows which profiles to include.

property.name: outputCondition
property.shortdesc: An optional comment field for inserting descriptions of the output condition. The text is stored in the PDF/X file.

property.name: outputConditionID
property.shortdesc: The identifier for the output condition.

property.name: registryName
property.shortdesc: The URL where the output condition is registered.

classdef.name: PICTFileSaveOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options for saving a document in PICT format.

property.name: alphaChannels
property.shortdesc: If true, the alpha channels are saved.

property.name: embedColorProfile
property.shortdesc: If true, the color profile is embedded in the document.

property.name: resolution
property.shortdesc: The number of bits per pixel.

property.name: compression
property.shortdesc: The compression method.

classdef.name: PICTResourceSaveOptions
classdef.shortdesc: Options for saving a document as a PICT resource file.

classdef.name: PathPointInfo
classdef.shortdesc: A point on a path, expressed as an array of three coordinate arrays: the anchor point, left direction point, and right direction point. For paths that are straight segments (not curved), the coordinates of all three points are the same. For curved segements, the coordinates are different. The difference between the anchor point and the left or right direction points determines the arc of the curve. You use the left direction point to bend the curve "outward" or make it convex; you use the right direction point to bend the curve "inward" or make it concave.

property.name: anchor
property.shortdesc: The x and y coordinates of one end point of the path segment.

property.name: leftDirection
property.shortdesc: The location of the left direction point ("in" position).

property.name: rightDirection
property.shortdesc: The location of the right direction point ("out" position).

property.name: kind
property.shortdesc: The point type.
